Methods

SafeOrderBy<T>(IEnumerable<T>?)

Orders the elements of a sequence in ascending order using IComparable<T>, and returns an empty collection if the source is null.

public static IEnumerable<T> SafeOrderBy<T>(this IEnumerable<T>? source) where T : IComparable<T>

Parameters

source IEnumerable<T>

The IEnumerable<T> to order.

Returns

IEnumerable<T>

The ordered IEnumerable<T>.

Type Parameters

T

The Type of the elements in the IEnumerable<T>.

SequenceEqualOrdered<T>(IEnumerable<T>?, IEnumerable<T>?)

Compares two sequences by ordering them using IComparable<T>, and then comparing for equality using SequenceEqual<TSource>(IEnumerable<TSource>, IEnumerable<TSource>)
If either sequence is null, it is treated as an empty collection.

public static bool SequenceEqualOrdered<T>(this IEnumerable<T>? first, IEnumerable<T>? second) where T : IComparable<T>

Parameters

first IEnumerable<T>

The first sequence to compare.

second IEnumerable<T>

The second sequence to compare.

Returns

bool

Type Parameters

T

The Type of elements in the sequences.
